Description: THE COAST SUMMER INTERNSHIP PROGRAM WAS CREATED IN 2011 AND PLACES CSU UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WITH STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES, NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND PRIVATE INDUSTRY. STUDENT INTERNS WORK SIDE BY SIDE WITH PROFESSIONALS ON CURRENT PROJECTS IN SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH, RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND PUBLIC POLICY THROUGHOUT CALIFORNIA. THROUGH THIS PROGRAM, STUDENTS ENGAGE IN HANDS-ON RESEARCH AND EXPERIENTIAL ACTIVITIES, LEARN VALUABLE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE THE WORKFORCE FIRST HAND. SINCE 2011, COAST HAS SUCCESSFULLY PLACED MORE THAN 120 CSU STUDENTS WITH INTERNSHIP HOSTS.  THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM RUNS FOR TEN WEEKS EVERY SUMMER, DURING WHICH STUDENT INTERNS SERVE 40 HOURS PER WEEK. THEY RECEIVE A STIPEND TO HELP THEM DEFRAY LIVING EXPENSES WHILE THEY ENGAGE IN THIS EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE. COAST PROVIDES HALF OF THE STIPEND COST AND THE HOST PROVIDES THE OTHER HALF. PROVIDING STIPENDS IS CRITICAL TO ENSURING THAT THERE IS A DIVERSE POOL OF APPLICANTS INCLUDING STUDEN

THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS WORK IS TO FACILITATE THE SHIFT TOWARD ECOSYSTEM BASED FISHERIES MANAGEMENT BY OPTIMIZING THE LARGE-SCALE COLLECTION OF FISH TROPHIC DATA IN THE GULF OF MEXICO. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES INCLUDE 1) INTEGRATING STABLE ISOTOPE INFORMATION INTO EXISTING ECOSYSTEM MODELS; 2) SURVEY OPTIMIZATION FOR ECOSYSTEM MONITORING; AND, 3) SURVEY OPTIMIZATION FOR FOOD WEB RECONSTRUCTION.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE SEA EDUCATION ASSOCIATION (SEA) IN ITS COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS OF THE WOODS HOLE DIVERSITY INITIATIVE (WHDI) IN WOODS HOLE MASSACHUSETTS, A COLLABORATION BETWEEN SIX WOODS HOLE-BASED SCIENCE INSTITUTIONS INCLUDING NOAA FISHERIES, WOODS HOLE OCEANOGRAPHIC INSTITUTION, USGS, SEA EDUCATION ASSOCIATION, MARINE BIOLOGICAL LABORATORY, AND WOODS HOLE RESEARCH CENTER. THIS SPONSORSHIP IS FOR AN ONGOING SERIES OF UNDERGRADUATE ACTIVITIES, LECTURES AND PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO INCREASE DIVERSITY IN THE WOODS HOLE MARINE SCIENCE COMMUNITY.
IMPROVING FISHING INDUSTRY ENGAGEMENT IN OFFSHORE WIND PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES
COLLABORATIVE EFFORT FOR AN ONGOING SERIES OF ACTIVITIES AND PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO INCREASE DIVERSITY.
USING HABITAT-SPECIFIC, SPATIAL DEMOGRAPHIC INFORMATION TO IMPROVE STOCK ASSESSMENTS OF GROUNDFISHES
COLLABORATIVE EFFORT FOR AN ONGOING SERIES OF ACTIVITIES AND PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO INCREASE DIVERSITY.
